newsitem.title: JAPAN: Key 182nd JGB yield falls to 2.135 percent.
newsitem.headline: Key 182nd JGB yield falls to 2.135 percent.

text.p: The yield of the benchmark 182nd cash Japanese government bond fell to an all-time low of 2.135 percent in afternoon trade on Friday.
The previous all-time low for a benchmark JGB yield was 2.140 percent, set on Wednesday.
Short-squeezing by dealers seems to be pushing the benchmark JGB yield lower, a brokerage house trader said.
"Investors may be buying the issue, but I think it's primarily short-squeezing and position adjustment by dealers ahead of the key U.S. jobs data," the trader said.
The benchmark 182nd JGB yield had fallen to as low as 2.120 percent as of 0729 GMT.
